articles.title: Politics latest: Migrant barge described as 'floating example of catastrophic failure' as ministers target 'unscrupulous' immigration lawyers
articles.description: The home secretary and justice secretary have announced a "task force" to root out dodgy lawyers after reports that false asylum claims are being submitted for a fee. But Labour says it's "too little too late", blaming Tories for "chaos" in the immigration system.
articles.content:

By Tim Baker, political reporter

articles.title: ‘Sabotage everywhere’: at the Swiss birthplace of global anarchism
articles.description: Thousands of anarchists made the pilgrimage to the small town of St-Imier for “Anarchy 2023”. Their positions, for example on Ukraine, differ widely.
articles.content:
An anarchist book fair held at St-Imier's ice rink was one of many events organised for the 150th anniversary of the anarchist International gathering in the small town in northwest Switzerland. Thomas Kern/swissinfo.ch

articles.title: Trumpetfish shadow other species to sneak up on their prey
articles.description: Scientists claim it is first non-human example of a predator using another animal to hide itself when hunting
articles.content:
They do not use a false beard, dark glasses or hide behind newspapers, but when it comes to shadowing others, trumpetfish could give private detectives a run for their money.

articles.title: DEI teacher mocked principal Richard Bilkszto who later killed himself: audio
articles.description: An anti-racism instructor who publicly attacked a Toronto principal — who ultimately committed suicide — can be heard in newly released audio laughing as she used his comments as an example of white supremacy “resistance.”
articles.content:
An anti-racism instructor was recorded mocking and laughing at a beloved Toronto principal who challenged her teachings — holding him up as an example of white supremacy “resistance,” according to a report.
Richard Bilkszto, 60, later committed suici... [2610 chars]

articles.title: Mumbai woman defies norms, sets heartwarming example by donating kidney to daughter-in-law
articles.description: "Amisha is like a daughter to me, and a mother can go to any lengths to save her child's life," said Prabha, the senior citizen from Kandivali who turned out to be a perfect match for daughter-in-law Amisha.
articles.content:
In a remarkable tale that challenges societal norms and underscores the power of compassion, a 70-year-old woman in Mumbai has shattered conventions by selflessly donating a kidney to her daughter-in-law, who was battling renal failure.
Last year, th... [737 chars]

articles.title: some think it will cost the city its soul in the end
articles.description: 'This is a stark example of the preventable loss of Manchester's rich history'
articles.content:
Last week, Manchester town hall's planning committee gave the go-ahead for yet another plan for yet another high-rise block in the city centre. But this time, a Grade II-listed building would have to be demolished.

articles.title: Sadiq Khan suggests Home Counties create their own Ulez scrappage schemes
articles.description: Mr Khan suggested the Home Counties follow the example of Merton Council, which has created a £1m scrappage scheme for its own residents
articles.content:
The mayor announced late on Thursday evening that he is opening up Transport for London’s (TfL) Ulez scrappage scheme to every Londoner who has a non-compliant vehicle - along with the addition of £50m to the fund.

articles.title: Judge allows key US antitrust Google search claims to go to trial
articles.description: "A company with monopoly power acts unlawfully only when its conduct stifles competition," Mehta wrote. Mehta also said that the government would have to show that each particular action - for example how Google handles search advertising - is a violation of antitrust law.
articles.content: A U.S. judge hearing the Justice Department's antitrust lawsuit accusing Google of unlawfully maintaining monopolies in the internet search market let stand key claims made by the federal government. Google, a unit of Alphabet, had asked for summary ... [3046 chars]
